explanation: The root "port" comes from the Latin verb *portare*, meaning "to carry" or "to bear". It is found in many English words related to **moving, transporting**, or **conveying** things, ideas, or even people from one place to another.
level_note: This root is commonly found in words ranging from B1 to C1 CEFR levels.

words.logic: Tiếp tố "im-" (vào) kết hợp với gốc "port" (mang) tạo nên ý nghĩa là mang cái gì đó từ bên ngoài vào một quốc gia hoặc khu vực khác.
words.meaning_en: to bring goods or services into a country from abroad for sale; an item brought from abroad
words.example: The country decided to import more oil to meet domestic demand.

collocations.example: We primarily import goods from China and Vietnam.
The import duty on luxury cars is quite high.
You need an import license to bring certain chemicals into the country.

forms.example: These imports are subject to a high tariff.
She works for a large coffee importer.

words.logic: Tiếp tố "ex-" (ra) kết hợp với gốc "port" (mang) tạo nên ý nghĩa là mang cái gì đó từ bên trong ra bên ngoài một quốc gia hoặc khu vực khác.
words.meaning_en: to send goods or services to another country for sale; an item sent to another country for sale
words.example: Vietnam continues to export a significant amount of rice globally.

collocations.example: The company is looking to expand into new export markets.
Last year, the export volume of electronic goods increased by 10%.
He founded an export company specializing in agricultural products.

forms.example: Coffee is one of Brazil's main exports.
She is a leading exporter of textiles.

words.logic: Tiếp tố "trans-" (xuyên qua) kết hợp với gốc "port" (mang) tạo nên ý nghĩa là mang hoặc di chuyển một thứ gì đó hoặc ai đó từ nơi này qua nơi khác.
words.meaning_vi: vận chuyển, chuyên chở; phương tiện giao thông
words.meaning_en: to take or carry people or goods from one place to another; a system or means of conveying passengers or goods
words.example: The company uses trucks to transport goods across the country.

collocations.example: I prefer using public transport to driving in the city.
It's costly to transport goods by air.
The city has an efficient transport network.

forms.example: A good transportation system is vital for economic growth.
The cargo was carried by a heavy-duty transporter.

words.logic: Tiếp tố "sub-" (dưới) kết hợp với gốc "port" (mang) tạo nên ý nghĩa là mang đỡ, nâng đỡ từ bên dưới, hoặc giúp đỡ, khuyến khích ai đó.
words.meaning_vi: ủng hộ, hỗ trợ; sự ủng hộ, vật chống đỡ
words.meaning_en: to hold up; to give help or encouragement to someone or something; help, encouragement, or a base that holds something up
words.example: Many people gathered to support the local charity event.

collocations.example: The project received significant financial support from the government.
Friends and family offered her great emotional support during her illness.
The candidate has strong support from young voters.

forms.example: My parents are very supportive of my career choice.
He is a loyal supporter of the football team.

words.logic: Tiếp tố "re-" (trở lại) kết hợp với gốc "port" (mang) tạo nên ý nghĩa là mang thông tin trở lại, tức là kể lại, tường trình hoặc báo cáo về một sự việc.
words.meaning_vi: báo cáo, tường trình; bài báo cáo
words.meaning_en: to give a description of something or information about it to someone; a spoken or written account that gives information about a particular event or subject
words.example: The journalist will report live from the scene of the accident.

collocations.example: You need to submit a report by the end of the week.
Please write a report on your findings.
We filed a police report after the theft.

forms.example: A news reporter was covering the protests.
He was reportedly seen leaving the building at midnight.

table.result: report (mang lại thông tin, báo cáo)
